headline: Lemon Buttermilk Pound Cake with Aunt Evelyn's Lemon Glaze
description: This lemon buttermilk cake is a blue-ribbon winner. Lemon fanatics will delight in thrice the lemon: extract in the cake and zest and juice in the glaze.

video.description: A delicious citrus flavored pound cake.
video.name: Lemon-Buttermilk Pound Cake with Aunt Evelyn's Lemon Glaze

name: Lemon Buttermilk Pound Cake with Aunt Evelyn's Lemon Glaze

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a fluted tube pan (such as Bundt).
Make the cake: Sift flour, salt, and baking soda together in a bowl.

Beat sugar and butter in a bowl with an electric mixer for 10 minutes. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add flour mixture in three batches, alternating with buttermilk, beating well after each addition and ending with the flour mixture. Stir in lemon extract. Pour batter into the prepared pan.

Place into the preheated oven and immediately reduce the oven temperature to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, 60 to 75 minutes.

Remove from the oven and cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Tap the pan firmly a few times, then shake it gently to loosen the cake. Place a wire rack over the pan and invert to release cake onto the rack. Set the rack and cake over a sheet of parchment paper.
Make the glaze: Beat confectioner's sugar, lemon juice, butter, and lemon zest in a bowl with an electric mixer until smooth.
Pour about 1/2 of the glaze over the warm cake. Let cool for 20 minutes, then pour remaining glaze over top.

review.reviewBody: Great cake. Everyone loved it.
No changes, perfect as is.
Wonderful recipe!
I made this cake for Thanksgiving it turned out really great. I did add extra freshly squeezed lemon juice to the cake batter. Everyone loved the cake.
Beautiful and delicious! Perfect amount of lemon flavor.
This is my go to cake for EVERYTHING!!!! I made one for work JB, it’s a favorite of mine.❤️❤️❤️

Excellent, made this for my anniversary. My husband was very happy. I added vanilla extract and a few drops of almond extract. I used White Lily all purpose flour. So good. Will make this again real soon.
Very good lemon pound cake. I changed a few things, such as adding whole milk instead of buttermilk, I used baking powder instead of baking soda, and a little less sugar- 1 cup instead of 1 1/4 cup.

Delicious lemon cake. Made a second time and I used lemon jam in the recipe to increase the moistness and lemon flavor. I also used the lemon jam heated with water and butter for the glaze and it turned out beautifully!
This is so delicious I did add a little more lemon juice to the glaze, overall this is a great cake.
Very moist cake with tasty lemon glaze. I added some lemon zest to the cake batter along with some yellow gel food coloring.

This cake was too dry for my liking, though the glaze was out of this world. It also tasted too floury. I made several holes on top of the cake before pouring the glaze over it. Next time, I will take it out 10 minutes earlier and double the glaze. If the cake is still too dry, I will keep the glaze recipe and find another lemon cake.
Delicious.

I made this cake for the first time tonight and OMG! It is amazing. My family loved it. I made two changes. I added a 1/4 teaspoon of baking powder and instead of 3 1/2 cups of all purpose flour I used two cups of all purpose flour and 1 1/2 cups of cake flour. So light and wonderful. My new go to cake.
Very good. I added lemon juice along with the extract, because the extract had such a fake “lemon” taste. I’d make this again.
This is a moist pound cake. My husband really liked it! Made no changes. Came out great.
This recipe was edible but dry and bland. I specifically looked for a moist lemon cake but this isn't it.

I literally have never left a review for a recipe but I felt I should do that given the different things that I saw. I read the positive and negative comments about the cake. I copied what one reviewer did and added half a cup of cream cheese and did 1/2 cup less of butter. I also added about a fourth a cup of sour cream. That left me with one stick of butter (1 cup). I also decided to add in a couple of tablespoons of lemon juice to the batter in addition to the extract because several people said the cake did not taste lemon. That helped a ton. I probably only added about a cup and 3/4 of sugar because I like a less sweet cake. The frosting on top made it perfect. I’ll give it a four stars because without this helpful template I would not have made this cake. Also appreciated the other reviewer‘s input.
Very dry and even with extra lemon in batter was not very good.
Followed the recipe exactly except I added extra 1/2t lemon extract. I thought it was still bland with a slight flour taste. Texture was good. Might try again with more or different extract.

Very soft and fluffy texture. The glaze is too sweet it honestly could only use one layer if none at all. I also adjusted the sugar to the cake: i used 1 cup honey, 1 cup sugar, leave out the extra half cup. Mixed in a cup of blueberries with the extract and added a tablespoon of zest. Cooked for 68 minutes exactly. Everything else was the same as listed. Definitely a must try!!

Delicious! I baked in two bread pans because I don’t have a Bundt pan. I intended to start checking it around 30 minutes.Not sure how long it actually took because of burning something on the bottom of the oven and having to turn the oven off and clear the house of smoke and then put the cakes back in to resume baking. Even with all that they turned out so delicious!
super easy to make!! Great taste!!
This is such a great recipe! I’ve made it a few times and it’s always a crowd pleaser
Slightly increased the lemon ingredient. But this was amazing!!!

Absolutely delicious recipe! Super moist and not overly dense. After baking I realized I only had 1 cup of powdered sugar for frosting. I added some cream cheese to thicken and cut some of the tartness. Will definitely make again.
Made it!!! Followed recipe exactly.
This cake was outstanding. I didn't have buttermilk so I substituted 2 Tablespoons of lemon juice with enough heavy cream to make one cup. This one will go in my recipe file.

Delicious! I followed the recipe ALMOST perfectly. I used gluten free flour. I used the same amount of flour as the recipe called for. I used King Arthur Measure for Measure. The cake was moist and delicious. The lemon glaze was quite sweet but very lemony and yummy. Will definitely make this again.
I’ve made this recipe a handful of times and it’s a winner 5/5. My family prefers a bit less sugar so we use 1 3/4 cups. Prefect! Thank you for sharing!
I followed the recipe exactly but I baked in 2 loaf pans ...

I made this for Christmas and my family asked me to make it again. The first time I made the recipe exact and the second time I doubled the frosting (per family member requests) and added a little lemon zest to the batter. It was great and I’ll definitely be making this again.
I made no changes.The cake was really good. My family loved it. I will bake it again and again.
Absolutely delicious!
The cake turned out deliciously, I used less icing, because the lemon juice had the icing tart.Will pass the recipe on. Thanks
Made this exactly as recipe....big hit....fabulous. Love the ìcing...has a nice lemony tang.
Excellent! Will make again! Followed directions made no changes
I wasn't sure about the recipe when I read it. It has been a hit with my family. I added extra lemon zest and 2 additional oz. of milk.
Very easy recipe. My in-house food critic said it was delicious!
Try 60 mins opposed to the recommended 1:15.
This is by far the best lemon pound cake . So many people have commented on this being the best they've ever had. I followed the recipe exactly.

This is wonderful! I made some adjustments for high altitude. We live at 7,000 feet altitude and they worked! I won’t bore you with them, but the cake didn’t fall, as some have experienced. I also added a cup of blueberries. Beautiful!

Excellent pound cake recipe but not
that lemony in flavour; however, it was a really, really pound cake in crumb and texture. Next time I'll add lemon zest to the cake batter or change the flavour altogether and make a vanilla version or maybe a maple. This recipe is definitely a keeper!!!
Easy recipe! Cake is moist and delicious.
Love this.... so good. I made it in a 9x13 pan.
A keeper. So easy and had that real lemon flavor. Have made in a bundt and second time in two loaf pans. A big hit. Thank you.
Love Love Love this Cake!!!

Incredible cake! As another reviewer wisely stated, this is not your daughter's cake. It is an old-fashioned, dense, moist and tender cake with a perfect complimentary lemon glaze. Nothing more is needed! It is my new favorite. Thank you so much for sharing this blue ribbon winner!
Each and every time I use this recipe, everyone who tastes it loves it. I vow this is the only one I will continue to use. It's perfect each time
4 stars as written...glaze was just too much. 5 stars without glaze! Thank you for sharing.
I made this cake and...OH MY GAWD!!!

I have never made a pound cake before. In fact, I didn't realize it can be difficult to make until mine was already in the oven! This one came out beautifully and I am ridiculously happy that it came out so well. I am very happy to have found this recipe!
Just heavenly. Very light and delicious pound cake with a slight lemon flavor. The most lemon flavor comes from the sugar glaze on top. Will be making this again!
This is a recipe worth the time to make. The lemon cake was delicious and easy to make.

Very good. I do not know what a five star cake tastes like but this is close. The glaze is what adds the lemon flavor. I added lemon rind to the cake recipe and used two small angel food pans to get two smaller cakes. One for us and one as a gift.

I made this for my friend for her birthday; she actually had tears in her eyes as she ate it (in a good way). She offered me a piece, and I have to admit, it was beyond good!!! It tasted like , well, I'm not sure, but you will love it!!

Absolutely lovely cake. Make sure you beat that sugar and butter for 5 minutes. I used powder buttermilk and replaced the lemon for vanilla and almond flavor (after having made the lemon recipe about 5 times!). Delicious. I made an almond /glaze syrup with a bit of amaretto. Yum.
I had to use gluten free flour and still turned out ok. Cake itself didn’t have much lemon flavor but worked well with the frosting and berries.

Oh my Lord in Heaven! Sarah Copeland Sawicki-this dessert aficionado (and her family) owes you a debt of gratitude for this winner of a recipe. I made it for a family birthday party and we had only 2 (small) pieces left over. Everyone raved about it. Our 7 year old granddaughter proclaimed she had never tasted a cake so delicious, and she’s one of those people, like me, who prefers chocolate desserts.

I followed this recipe to a “T” except for the lemon extract in the cake. I didn’t have any, so I used 2 tablespoons of fresh lemon juice instead. Everything else was per the recipe, including the buttermilk. We fought over the stray pieces of cake that were leftover in the cake pan once I transferred it to a serving platter—it was that good. I had never beaten cake batter for 10 minutes before, so I think that—along with the rich ingredients, and especially the buttermilk—is what makes this cake so outstanding. It’s definitely restaurant quality. It has a bit of a crunchy crust in spots which adds to its deliciousness. I was worried it may be too dense or dry, but it was perfect. The glaze is superb too. I may try this with a strawberry glaze next time. 

Note: I baked in a dark Bundt pan and it took 55 minutes using the toothpick test. I only mention this because some reviewers said they had to bake theirs longer than the 60-75 minutes of recommended time. Be sure to check for doneness a few minutes early. Thanks for the keeper.
One of the best. My family loved it.

This recipe is very good. I actually went a little overboard with the baking time as I was reading so many people saying that theirs was coming out raw in the middle. It is dense but moist. I will make it again, but as a preference I would cut down the sugar of the mix and the glaze. Next time, I will worry less about the baking time and just adjust the sugars to my preference and that is it. I recommend to do a test run depending on the type of pan you will use. Dark ones tend to brown and dry out the edges pretty quick. I will keep in mind as this was the first time I was using this brand new small fluted pan. My next tip would be to lower the temperature by 25F if your pan is dark regardless of its type/shape. This cake benefits from slow baking at a low temperature. Which leads me to my last tip: do not to haste the cake, take your time and add minutes accordingly, but let it bake for the first 45 minutes without opening the oven. Resist this temptation by any means. The first 45 minutes are crucial same as the long slow baking.
As advertised, delicious.
Will make this again and again,
I actually substituted almond for the lemon in both the cake and frosting. It was delicious.

This recipe was DELICIOUS! Once reviewer compared it a Starbucks lemon pound cake. I would have to agree. I didn't have lemon extract (mistake reading the ingredients) so I used 1 teaspoon of lemon juice and the zest of 2 lemons instead. I was afraid this would affect the lemon flavor but it didn't at all. Everything else I followed the recipe exactly. My family and I could not stop eating it! We will definitely be making this again.
Great cake!! Just the right amount of lemon flavor! I followed the recipe exactly. The cake was not too dense and very moist! my family ate this up! I will definitely make this a regular!
Added lemon jest and lemon juice to both the cake and frosting. DO NOT SUGAR THE PAN. IT WILL STICK.
Made this recipe as directed and it was outstanding!!
Perfect for our Easter dessert!
I made this cake yesterday and it was wonderful!! My husband has already eaten half! I did not make any alterations to the recipe. I will definitely be making this cake over and over!!
Amazing recipe; I added 1/4 of lemon juice to the batter instead of 1 tbsp. Tasted very lemony good.

I followed the recipe exactly as advised and it is delicious, my daughter and I almost finished the whole thing in a day. We will definitely be baking another one soon. It’s my to go to for pound cakes for now on. Thanks for sharing

I have been using this recipe for four years it’s a staple in my family! I absolutely love it just follow the recipe and use real lemons not lemon juice from concentrate and it will be bomb!
Delicious! First time, All good!

Thanks, for having this sure fire hit in your cache of cake recipes.

Christine Santee
Wood Village, OR

Great Recipe. My family just loved it. I did however, add 1 T of Fresh Lemon |Juice and 1 more tsp of Lemon extract to the cake as we LOVE Lemon. I think this recipe can easily be altered in flavour wthout changing texture. The glaze was a little too much in quantity but so what if you have leftover. - Carol
Some of these pictures are down right scary! ha - anyway it is delicious but very airy. And people mix your icing more - it should not be lumpy! Wow
Delicious!
Moist and delicious cake.

Hello everyone, i made this Lemon-Buttermilk Pound Cake twice now and everyone loved it. The only small change i made was to add another half cup of Buttermilk instead of 1 cup. I also baked it on 325 degrees from start to finish. this cake is absolutely delicious.
The only change that I would make is putting more lemon extract or adding lemon juice to the cake mix.
I love this recipe. I only made changes because of my 6500 ft elevation.
This is the 1st time I ever made a pound cake and my family loved it! It was very moist and extremely delicious ! It will now be on the holiday menu..

I loved this cake! Super easy to make. It tastes delicious as written in the recipe, but if you like a bit more lemon flavor, follow the suggestion from a previous review: cut 1/4 cup buttermilk and add 1/4 cup lemon juice. adds just a little more of the lemon flavor to the cake.

Less 1/2 c sugar, added 1 tsp almond extract as well as the lemon, also 1 c chopped drained maraschino cherries, added at very last (can toss in a scant 1/4 cup flour to reduce juices)...awesomeness!

First time making and It was a success for Christmas!!!
Thanks for posting this recipe. It is truly award winning and delicious. Cudos to Aunt Gladys for the icing.

Amazing cake , the glaze is extremely sweet by itself so I felt it would mess the cake up . In the end I finally put it on the cake and it’s was wonderful! Read others suggestions is highly recommend for this cake because it helped me definitely! 
Thanksgiving Day Cake 2019
This was amazing! I made them as individual bunny cakes for Easter and they came out perfectly.
I have made this recipe for over 12 years. I always add 8 oz. cream cheese.

I read reviews before I made this because I was also looking to make something similar to the Starbucks lemon slice. I made a few changes. I added 1Tbsp lemon zest to the batter along with squeezing about 1Tbsp of that lemon into the batter. I also agree that it's important to whip this batter for 10 minutes to get it light and fluffy as stated. I poured my batter into 2 glass loaf pans and 1 little one and it took close to 90 minutes to bake through the large loaves. I made my frosting with 2 cups of powdered sugar beat with 3Tbsp melted butter 1tsp of lemon extract and added lemon juice to obtain the right consistency. I think it turned out great! I want to also say that had I had meringue powder I would have tried the frosting with 2 cups powdered sugar, 2Tbsp meringue powder and 1tsp lemon extract for a hard frosting but maybe next time.
Everyone loved it! I will definitely make it again! Crowd pleaser!

I haven’t even tasted it yet but I know this will be a favourite recipe. The lemony smell as it was baking was divine, the only thing I added was I put a little bit of lemon zest into the batter with the lemon extract. It came out perfectly, got a great rise which was very surprising based on the amount of baking sofa but the 10 minutes to beat the egg and sugar to a fluffy soft consistence go a long way to keeping this cake light.
